result.execSummary:
The defendant JaJuan Q. SHAW was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Solicitation of Prostitutes [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.
  • Pandering-Solicitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.33(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.
The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence in count 1.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is not to leave his county of residence without the agent's approval.

Defendant is to have no contact with the victim, her family, her residence or any temporary residence she occupies.  Defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent, except for immediate family.

No use of possession of the internet or internet enabled devices without approval and no use of any social media websites and all passwords are to be turned over to the agent.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.  Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County Jail.  No electronic monitoring is allowed.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant is not to leave his county of residence without the agents approval.
	
Defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent, except for his immediate family.

No use or possession of the internet or internet enabled devices without approval and no use of social media websites and all passwords are to be turned over to the agent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JaJuan Q. SHAW

MOTION TO PERMIT TRANSFER OF PROBATION TO MARINETTE COUNTY - 
The Court has read the submissions of both parties and is ready to rule on the motion.
Neither party wish to present anything further.
The Court comments.  Its clear the defendant didnt take his travel restriction  seriously.  There is nothing in the record to undermine the original order of the court to restrict his movements.  There is no basis for the court to intervene or modify the previously ordered conditions.

It is hereby ordered that the condition of the defendant's bond that requires daily, in person contact be eliminated and that the defendant shall give a copy of his paycheck stub to Attorney Hayes as frequently as is the defendant is paid.  In the event the defendant is not employed fulltime, defendant shall inform Attorney Hayes who shall, in turn, inform the State in order that the parties may stipulate to additional modifications of the conditions of the defendant's bond.  And, the parties agree that the defendant does not need to personally appear at status or scheduling conferences conducted in this case.

ADDRESS INFO for JaJuan Q. SHAW
Current: 2533 N. 50th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2014)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$1,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.  
This case was set for a motion hearing this morning.   Defense was just provided with a substantial volume of facebook information.  Defense has agreed to withdraw his request for speedy trial demand to allow the defense proper time to prepare.  In exchange, counsel have agreed to a bail modification.  
Defendant's bail is to be modified to $1,000.00 cash with the following conditions:
1) Defendant is required to report daily to his attorney's office by 3:00 p.m. on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday.  Should he not appear the attorney is required to notify the court by 3:30 p.m.  
2) Defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department by 3:00 p.m. every Sunday and Monday.  
3) Defendant is prohibited from traveling outside the counties of Waukesha, Ozaukee, Manitowoc, Milwaukee, Racine, Kenosha, Washington, and Sheboygan..
4) Defendant is to have no contact with the victim or her residence. 
5) Defendant is to have no contact with David Dulek or Demetrius Gordon. 
6) Defendant is to have no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.
7) Defendant must make all court appearances.  
Status conference set for 08-25-14 at 11:30 a.m.  
Defendant puts his withdrawal of speedy trial demand on the record. Court accepts defendant's withdrawal.  
Defense counsel files a written withdrawal of speedy trial.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.

Defendant in custody.  
State files an Information charging 1 ct. Trafficking of a Child, contrary to Section 948.051(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-27-14 at 1:30 p.m.

The parties argue the motion.
The Court modifies bail to $10,000.00 cash with the same conditions as previously ordered and adding the conditions of no contact with Demitrius Gordon and no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-14-14 at 2:45 p.m.   
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of PTC 2nd degree sexual assault, false imprisonment and human trafficking.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-05-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with the victim, N.A.G, DOB: 07-25-1996 and David Dulek, that he not leave Manitowoc County without the court's permission and that he provide a local address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
